New Records: Quinton de Kock scored the ninth-highest individual score in World Cup history with 174 runs
De Kock surpassed India's Virat Kohli for the most runs in the World Cup
De Kock surpassed Australia's David Warner (163) for the highest individual score in this World Cup
Key Match Events: Marco Jansen took two crucial wickets in the seventh over
Kagiso Rabada trapped Litton Das leg-before
Gerald Coetzee took three wickets for 62 runs
Mahmudullah scored a century and formed crucial partnerships to reduce the margin of defeat
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa leapfrogged New Zealand to jump to the second spot in the points table
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa posted a mammoth total of 382 for 5 in the group stage match
De Kock's 140-ball innings featured a remarkable late surge
David Miller's unbeaten 15-ball 34 led the final 10 overs scoring spree of 144 runs
Others: The match took place at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium
Bangladesh fell to their fourth straight loss in the World Cup
Heinrich Klaasen returned to form after a two-day break
